title: [Large-Scale] Understanding the Correlation Between Attitudes, Self-Esteem, and Loneliness in Online Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Online learning experience and fundamental digital literacy
context.additional_context: Course supporting entry-level professional development in social fields for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain the impact of online learning attitudes on self-esteem formation.

Learners can design self-esteem enhancement strategies (3 personalized strategies) that meet at least 4 of the 5 peer assessment rubric criteria by utilizing online interaction strategies (e.g., feedback requests, empathetic responses, positive language use).
Learners can suggest at least three strategies for managing loneliness in online learning environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
